justification: "The main dependent variable for all experiments is empathy choice as measured by the Empathy Selection Task."

measured_by: NASA Task Load Index – Mental Demand item
justification: The authors state that participants answered the NASA Task Load Index question "How mentally demanding was this deck?", noting that the TLX "is an assessment of subjective cognitive costs."

measured_by: NASA Task Load Index – Self-Efficacy item
justification: The fourth TLX question "How successful were you in accomplishing what you were asked to do in this deck?" is described as measuring "self-efficacy."

measured_by: NASA Task Load Index – Aversiveness item
justification: The third TLX question "How insecure, discouraged, irritated, stressed, and annoyed were you by this deck?" is identified by the authors as assessing "aversiveness."
In Experiment 3a "participants also completed the Interpersonal Reactivity Index (Davis, 1980)," a standard trait empathy questionnaire.
Experiment 3a further reports that participants completed "the 22-item version of the Empathy Quotient (Wakabayashi et al., 2006)," another instrument assessing trait empathy.
